meanings.definition: The quality of being sensitive to radiation.
meanings.sent1: Her radiosensitivity meant she had to avoid excessive sun exposure.
meanings.sent2: The radiosensitivity of the plant made it susceptible to damage from radiation.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's radiosensitivity made them glow in the dark after a day at the beach.
meanings.sent4: The city's radiosensitivity to change made it difficult to implement new policies.
meanings.sent5: The child's radiosensitivity to loud noises made them cover their ears at the fireworks show.

meanings.definition: The degree to which an organism or tissue is sensitive to the effects of radiation.
meanings.sent1: The patient's radiosensitivity required special treatment during radiation therapy.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the radiosensitivity of different cell types to understand their response to radiation.
meanings.sent3: The cat's radiosensitivity to catnip made it the life of the party at the pet store.
meanings.sent4: The community's radiosensitivity to rumors spread faster than wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The tree's radiosensitivity to pollution was evident in its wilting leaves.
